Reviews.Title: “Just as good second time around”
Reviews.Author: MarkHowells
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay in Venice and our second stay at the Hotel Vecellio. Strangely enough, we even had the same room that we had 2 years ago. The hotel is ideally located for getting off the water bus with all that luggage and it is only a 15-20 minute walk to St Marks Square. Matteo was his usual cheerful self and was very helpful. Yes, the hotel has basic facilities, but people should know this as there are numerous reviews pointing this out. The hotel is clean and tidy and the breakfast is enough to get your day started. This hotel is great value for money and I would not hesitate to go back to it again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Venice”
Reviews.Author: trippingItaly
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vecellio is very easy to find, it's at water bus #4.2, Fondamente Nova, with only 8 rooms, overlooking the lagoon and the island San Michele, large comfortable bed, small by efficient bathroom. The owner is wonderful, you are his personal guest and he will help you find the authentic venetian experience. By water bus, or by foot, Venice is lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Buzz78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our second visit in two years to the hotel Vecellio, and just as per our previous stay the hotelâ€™s owner, Matteo, was very hospitable and welcoming. The rooms are spacious enough for two and were cleaned every day. Whilst the fixtures arenâ€™t brand new by any means we found everything to be perfectly clean and habitable. The breakfast is basic continental with breads, meats, cheeses, yoghurt and Matteo does make a lovely fresh coffee. The location of the hotel itself is relatively nice and quiet, particularly in the evening, but Rialto is only a 10 minute walk away and there are numerous Vaporetto stops literally on the hotelâ€™s doorstep so in that sense the location canâ€™t really be faulted. I have read that some people have visited this hotel with somewhat high expectations given the hotelâ€™s high average rating. Yes, this isnâ€™t a 5* luxury hotel, but if youâ€™re looking for very reasonably priced bed and breakfast accommodation (we paid Â£55 per night) in an superb location, then this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average room.”
Reviews.Author: rt5mrt
Reviews.Content: I guess after all the raving reviews here, I was expecting a spectacular hotel. I was disappointed. The room was very average. The bathroom needed to be cleaned better. The breakfast was poor and the coffee was ok. Having said all that, the place was still great value and is in a fantastic location. The service is friendly and if all you need is a place to dump your luggage and sleep then this is a good hotel. But don't come here expecting anything more - you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great finding. Beautiful place and service.”
Reviews.Author: MaluPena
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful petite boutique Hotel. I booked a superior room with a great view to the lagoon. The room was perfect! It had a desk, a closet, a safe, a TV and a huge bed. It was delightfully decorated in a classic style, eventhough everything appeared brand new, like the bathroom. It was spotless. The roof was made of wooden logs that made it really warm. The hotel had only 8 rooms in two floors. Breakfast was fine, not many optiones but very good quality of every product. Coffee was outstanding, as well as the Orange Juice freshly made. Location: Be very carefull when you look for a room in Venice. The city is full of bridges and cannals, and carrying your suitcase through the tiny streets packed with people, could be a nightmare. This is why I booked this hotel. It is located just infront of a vaporeto stop. YouÂ´ll only have to walk 10 Mts to your room. ItÂ´s infront of Fondamenta Nove, a 1o minutes walk to San Marco square, is you avoid getting lost. It was a great ending to our honeymoon. I definitely recommend this hotel and would come back in a heartbeat. Matteo, the owner, is always in a great moode and is a delightfull character. Do not hesitate to ask him anything.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel close to main sights”
Reviews.Author: Heybigtuna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vecellio recently for three nights and enjoyed our time in Venice. We had booked a New Year getaway at the last minute when all the central hotels were charging the earth for a room. We were very pleasantly surprised by the prices on offer from the Vecellio for this popular, busy time of year and decided to book as the location, right next to the Alilaguna stop at Fondamente Nove, was also perfect for us - no lugging suitcases over bridges! We like to stay in this Cannaregio area as it provides shelter from the crowds in the more touristy areas while at the same time only being a short walk from these places. The owner gave us a warm welcome without being overbearing, which was nice after an early start and long journey. He showed us to our room on the ground floor with a great view of the lagoon and San Michele. Unlike a few other reviewers have mentioned, we were not disturbed by the noise from the boats outside but we did visit in winter so had the windows shut most of the time. If you are a light sleeper though, I would suggest requesting a room on one of the upper floors as we could hear a lot of heavy footsteps coming from the room above ours, and also when people were using the main staircase which was next to our door. The room and bathroom were fairly small in size, as you would expect from a converted Venetian house, but manageable and had a lot of nice traditional Venitian features - the headboard, mirror, light fittings and soft furnishings. We found our room to be clean and the maid did an excellent job of sprucing it up each day for us. There were a few small issues that we had with the room but nothing we felt we needed to complain about due to the price we had paid, the short nature of our visit and the central location of the hotel. The TV in the room was small and very high up above the bed so hard to see. The volume also didn't work but we weren't in Venice to watch TV in our hotel room, we were there to absorb and enjoy the atmosphere of the city. If you do want to have the option of watching TV in your hotel room, please note that this hotel only has Italian channels. The wardrobe door in our room was coming away at the hinges which meant that it kept swinging open. The owner mentioned that he would fix it for us on arrival but didn't manage to during our stay so we wedged it shut with one of our suitcases. Also, one of the lights at the side of the bed wasn't working as the bulb needed changing, we only had one pillow each and no spares in the wardrobe, and the minibar was empty. The owner was so helpful I'm sure he would have helped us with these things but as I said, these are trivial problems and it was such a short stay on a budget spending so little time in the room, we didn't feel the need to kick up a fuss. The only other issue we had was that the maid left our window open while we were out one day - a bit worrying as we were on the ground floor. Luckily we popped back mid-afternoon for warmer clothing so were able to shut it before the room got too cold and we had most of our valuables with us while we were out and about. Do make sure if you are leaving anything valuable in the room when you go out to make use of the safe - I believe it is free of charge despite a 10E label on the door. Just ask at the desk. There are a couple of fun places very nearby: Algiubagio the restaurant is really excellent. We shared a large starter, had two mains, shared a dessert, a bottle of prosecco and two limoncellos for 110â‚¬. Considering the quality of the food, surroundings and service we considered this to be very reasonable for a holiday treat. There is also a friendly little pub called the Tartuga a little further up from Algiubagio that will serve you a lovely pre-dinner Spritz for just 3â‚¬. We were able to store our cases at the hotel after check out which was very helpful. The only other things maybe worth mentioning are that you must leave you key at reception whenever you go out, collecting it again on your return, and you will also see signs in the hotel reception and your room about tourist tax which you pay on checkout. What the signs don't tell you is how much this is. If you are a keen budgeter, the current cost for the Vecellio is 3â‚¬ per person per night for the first five nights of your stay. There is no charge after that. I imagine these rates are subject to change and I think you are able to try and claim it back when you get home but we were happy to pay a bit towards to maintenance and development of the city at that price. It didn't break the bank. All in all a good option if you want to be close to Rialto, San Marco, the Arsenale, Murano etc. and are on a budget. You will receive a friendly welcome and enjoy a suitable place to rest your weary head after all the walking about and enjoyment of the wonderful Italian hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Great value great location!”
Reviews.Author: Antras
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located within walking distance of the Rialto and San Marco but away from the busiest areas. It has in some rooms a view over the lagoon and is right next to a vaporetto stop. Our room was comfy, well equipped and clean and luckily one with a view over the water. Matteo was vey helpful and charming. We considered it excellent value for money and liked the fact there are only 8 rooms, much more personal. Just a couple of attentions to detail in that the shower head could do with changing and the breakfast could be more imaginative but it didn't spoil our trip at all. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vecellio is a charming hotel right on the waterfront and away from the many of the tourist traps. The room was comfortable, reasonably priced and located right at a vaporetti stop. There were no issues with noise. We were treated to a nice breakfast every morning and really enjoyed the company of Matteo who was quick with a joke and advice for us. We were able to walk to all the sites from this location and really appreciated the convenience of the area. Matteo is a gracious host and we would be happy to stay at Hotel Vecellio again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Definitely worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: coronashines
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. More like a private bed and breakfast because of the exceptional service. It was clean, well decorated, and very friendly. The location was great! We had never been to Venice before and it is literally steps from a main waterbus stop; Fondamente Nove. Breakfast was included and standard Italian of coffee, pastry, cheese, yogurt, etc. There is a great pizzera/bar steps from the front door with a full menu. It is only a few stops from Murano Island, Guglie (great shopping), airport, train station. Another rater's comment about the smell, I can slightly understand but welcome to Europe some citizens do not use deoderant and it was only a slight smell for a few steps. Do not let this impact your decision. The rooms we had were very large compared to other European hotels. I would easily say 20' X 15'. Truly will stay here again during my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great base camp for exploring Venice!”
Reviews.Author: safay
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vecellio is a very reasonably priced, clean, competently staffed little hotel with a fabulous location both for walking the city and for catching public boat transport, either to the other islands or to points throughout the city. I cannot imagine a better situated hotel for those arriving in Venice via air; we took the Alilaguna boat transport from the airport to the boat dock and arrived practically at the doorstep of the hotel! Our room was small but efficiently laid out, and the lagoon view (overlooking the little island of San Michele) was beautiful. Matteo, the owner, was attentive and helpful, and his small staff were polite and friendly. The included continental breakfast is provided in a nice little seating area adjoining the lobby. Hotel Vecellio's Cannaregio neighborhood is conveniently situated a refreshing distance from the more heavily touristed areas, but San Marco and the Rialto are within easy walking distance--provided you don't get lost trying to navigate Venice's byzantine streets (although getting lost in Venice is half the fun!).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location.....”
Reviews.Author: beetle274
Reviews.Content: Wanted to find a small hotel away from the crowds around San Marco and Rialto and Canaregio seemed the ideal location. All the reviews we read described a quiet and friendly, more residential area, but with plenty of places to eat and drink. Using Trip advisor as our guide we chose Hotel Vecellio....despite some rather bizzare complaints....like no lift!?...and old wooden beams!?.....in Venice! We made a good choice, the hotel was exactly what we wanted, small, friendly and romantic. We had a 'lagoon view' room overlooking cemetery island, with a restaurant and a vaporetto stop on our doorstep ( we had no problem with noise and were not disturbed at all ) which was really handy. There were several bars and restaurants in the immediate vicinity so you don't have to go far for refreshment! and you'll find them to be better value than those around the grand canal, as you would expect. The owner Matteo, feircely Venetian, is extremely friendly and helpful, and makes a mean capuccino! If staying in Venice again we will definitely stay at Hotel Vecellio.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Helen P
Reviews.Content: The Vecellio is a lovely small hotel on the waters edge. The owner, Matteo, was extremely pleasant and very helpful, he was happy to suggest restaurants and answer any questions we had. The rooms are very small but more than adequate, to be honest I don't think there is any such thing as a big room in Venice. The location was ideal, a short walk to the main walkways and right next to one of the boat docks where you can catch a ferry to Murano, Burano and so on (you could also get the ferry to these docks from the airport or train station). Breakfast is typically continental with juice, coffee, yoghurt, rolls, jams, and some little packets of pre-packed toast (which taste great with some chocolate spread!). Overall this hotel was great for our trip and we would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed It (Although a Little Noisy)”
Reviews.Author: vanitysvial
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at Hotel Vecellio in mid-September. Our room was #5 on the second floor (the one with the gold bed) with a view of the alley. Likes: * convenient location - It's seriously right next to the Fondamente Nove stop (although it doesn't run late). It's not too far to walk to Ca' d'Oro either. * pretty location - nice for strolls on the lagoon * room size - good enough for us (in our late 20s) * room look - I thought it looked classy. * breakfast - Matteo's coffee was good, and I appreciated that he had yogurt there and not just pastries. * staff - Matteo was great. One of the other workers (can't remember his name), introduced us to limoncello one of the nights and Matteo said it was on the house when we were checking out. Dislikes: * air conditioning - not particularly effective, and it condensed and dripped on the floor * noise - I can't imagine it'd be much better anywhere in Venice, but often crowds of people milling around the lagoon area would get loud late at night. Aside: When we were leaving, we got to the train station and thought we forgot our passports in the hotel room. My husband went back for them, but I found them after he was on the way. Luckily, I had the wireless internet hub and was able to e-mail Matteo (I had various phone problems throughout the trip, but e-mail worked), and he told my husband as soon as he got there so he didn't waste any time tearing up the room looking for them. Big thanks to Matteo for frequently checking his messages!

Reviews.Title: “Budget-conscious, but beware...”
Reviews.Author: JusticeRx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Vecellio for several nights in September, as part of a honeymoon tour around Italy. Pros: Matteo and the staff were personable, and the hotel is very convenient to the vaporetto (literally right outside the door!). The room we had was small, but adequate for laying our heads down at night after long days of walking and sightseeing. Cons: The bathroom unfortunately had quite a bit of mold in the shower area (in the grout/caulk) which caused the room to smell unpleasant, especially in the evening. The morning cleanings seemed to help in the short term, however! Our room was also on the ground floor with windows that directly faced the street, so privacy/quiet was difficult to come by, but that's to be expected. We never had the breakfast provided, as we preferred eating in the canals and squares and people-watching. Overall, this is a decent place for the budget traveler or those who will make frequent use of the vaporetto system, but I would not necessarily recommend to those in pursuit of "idyllic" romance in Venice! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Matteo & Georgio!!!”
Reviews.Author: db8mommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Vecellio in Venice. Matteo was wonderful and so kind to us! We would happily have him in our own home anytime! The room (#2) was comfortable and well decorated. The free wi-fi worked great for skyping with the kids back home. Awesome coffee and a modest breakfast - Matteo even tossed some extra peach croissants in my purse for our day trip to the beach at Lido! I am happy to recommend the hotel to friends and family for their future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay for the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: filthiestfish
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum for one night as we were going to catch a cruise the next day. We usually stay at the excellent Ca Formenta Hotel in Arsenale, but as we were only going to be in Venice for a few hours, we couldn't justify the high price tag of Ca Formenta, so instead we settled for this hotel as it was convenient to get to from the airport, and cost 88 Euros for the night, which is cheap for Venice. When we arrived late in the afternoon, we were greeted by Matteo, the hotel manager, who was laid back and friendly. We had booked the room 3 months in advance and had requested twin beds but Matteo told us that there were none, so we just had to do with a double. We later found out that our double bed was in fact two singles put together, so he could have really made an effort to sort two twin beds for us.Are there no twin rooms in the hotel? Anyway, he took us to our room upstairs (there is no lift so you have to carry your luggage up the stairs) to room 4. The room was small, dark and old. It had a broken window handle and broken electricity outlet with wires hanging out. The bathroom was tiny with an ancient rusty soapbox that had been replaced with a newer one on top to cover it. The shower cubicle was cramped with mould on the floor edges and the shower tap was broken with tape holding it together (see pic). Everything was old and in need of repairing/replacing. The air conditioning was rubbish too as it was very weak and produced no cold air and water was leaking from it. It was getting unbearably hot in the room due to the restricted windows and ancient air con, so I went back down to reception to see if anything could be done about it. At reception, there was now a very old gentleman who said he was there for the night, and Matteo would be back at 8am. When I explained to him about the air con he tried to fob me off by saying that it will work after 10 minutes. I said to him "I've already been here two hours and it's not working" so eventually he came to our room to have a look but did nothing as he didn't know how to do anything. I wonder just how long the air conditioning has been like this. The minibar was empty. If you wanted to use the room safe it was 10 Euros. The television set was tiny and was placed so high up you had to be a giraffe to view it, not that it mattered because although it had around 100 channels they were all Italian and there were no English channels like BBC or Sky News or CNN. The bed was actually quite comfy and probably the best thing about the room. The views of the lagoon were decent also, but we had paid extra for this. We went out in the evening to have dinner and didn't like having to leave the room key at reception. We were kept awake for much of the night as we had to keep the windows open to let some air in but there was a lot of noise coming from the restaurants outside and the night vaporetto. Breakfast was served in a tiny space with four tables next to reception and consisted of p!$$-poor pre packed tiny breadrolls and toast crackers, brought to our table in a basket by the manager, along with a little butter and a freshly made cup of coffee. There was a table with yogurts, jam, long life orange juice, and cheese triangles. I had to ask the manager for glasses for the orange juice. There was no real cheese, ham or salami. In fact, nothing on the breakfast table was real! So, to summarise, this is a 3* budget hotel worthy of a 2* rating. No way does this resemble a 3* hotel and therefore my rating reflects this. My advice to anyone reading this is that you should spend more money and stay somewhere nicer in Venice because your choice of hotel will really impact your stay and Venice is a beautiful city, so to give it justice, your experience will be enhanced by choosing the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We left after seeing the condition of the hotel and our room”
Reviews.Author: Sara34678
Reviews.Content: The Vecellio hotel is by far one of the worst hotels we have ever experienced. There are no elevators so my husband had to drag our suitcases to the second floor room. The ceilings consisted of outdated wooden rafters, the accessory chair was covered by a quilt, the toilet had permanent stains and the air conditioning unit was leaking water onto the ground. There is no lobby. We promptly searced for another hotel and were relieved to leave the Vecellio. There are so many options to choose from in Venice, please use one of those!!

Reviews.Title: “The beauty of Venice in a comfortable hotel away from the tourist crowds”
Reviews.Author: Tutto13Bella
Reviews.Content: if your looking for a quiet, comfortable, clean quaint hotel in Venice then Hotel Vecellio is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very tiny room with poor air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: pythogarus
Reviews.Content: We read some great reviews of the hotel which is why we booked this room from our bounce back from Dubrovnik, for one night. It is certainly in a great location - away from the crowds, yet a short and fun walk to the touristy spots of the city. However, for a steep price per night, we found poor service at the hotel. The receptionist was not very welcoming and the bathroom, although clean, was very cramped and the bidet and the sink did not have any drain stoppers. So, there were gaping holes, which were unpleasant sights. Also, being June, it was a warm day in Venice and the air conditioner was not working at all. Despite our complaints to the receptionist, nothing was done to fix the situation, and we ended up not having a good night's rest which was painful, as we had an early morning flight to catch back to the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nickel071
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two weeks ago on our visit to Venice. I was extremely worried about booking an easy-to-find hotel after reading online how easy it is to get lost on Venice's streets! Hotel Vecellio could not have been any easier to find! From the moment we walked through the front door, we were welcomed & treated as honored guests. The hotel staff were extremely friendly & accomodating, providing a level of service that definitely set the tone for our vacation. (We compared all of our other hotels on the trip to Vecellio. Only one other establishment came even close!) The room was clean & nicely appointed. The complimentary breakfast was the perfect start to the day. Our room overlooked the F. Nuove waterbus stop, which was a little noisy in the morning, but otherwise provided great views of the Cimitiere across the canal. I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Venice! Can't wait to return for another trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: all2u
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, with friendly staff. We had a small room, with great decorations, but a moist problem which only became apparent at night, and became annoying (air filled with a specific smell). Despite this inconvenience, the hotel is a nice place to stay. Although it is located opposite to the fondamente piers, it was still quiet at night when we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian hospitality at it's finest!”
Reviews.Author: truewallace
Reviews.Content: The date of my visit to Venice was actually in 2007 but I LOVED this hotel SO MUCH that I wanted to write a good review about it. My best friend and I traveled to Italy for my 30th birthday and had visited Rome and Florence before going to Venice. The other hotels I'd booked were fine. What you would expect for the price/area that they were in. I booked the Hotel Vecellio based on other reviews that said the owner, Matteo, was a godsend. He did NOT disappoint! We were shocked and awed by the beauty and cleanliness of our room at the Hotel Vecellio. It was leaps and bounds above where we stayed in Rome and Florence and for about the same price. The bed was comfortable and the room very clean. The location was okay since the water taxi was right outside the door. It got a little loud late and night and early in the morning. But other than that...it was fine. The breakfast was great and truly the hospitality was stupendous. When we explained to Matteo, who speaks nearly perfect english, that it was my birthday he immediately called his "friend" at this very chic restaurant and made sure they treated us in a grand fashion! He explained the intracacies of the Venetian "road" system to us and gave us great tips on how best to move about the city. Needless to say, our trip to Venice was the high point of our Itailian excursion and it was mostly due to Matteo and the terrific Hotel Vecellio.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Kelleygirl2
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vecellio is steps away from the second vaporetto stop from the airport to Venice. Right on the water, this charming little hotel has beautifully appointed rooms, a nice little breakfast and is a fun 15-20 minute walk to St Mark's and the Rialto (if you don't get lost which you likely will but that's half the fun!) Mario, the owner/manager will provide you with local color as well as great recommendations for restaurants that the locals go to. Who says food in Venice has to be bad and expensive? We had a ball staying here and would return on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Booked this hotel but placed in the Picolo Vecellio”
Reviews.Author: Possesibling
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay in for our anniversary but when we arrived, we were told we would be staying in their sister hotel, the Picolo Vecellio so my review is on there. If you are staying in the main hotel, it is just in front of the waterbus stop at Fondamente Nuove- please don't do a google map to find it like we did as it took us a long walk in the wrong direction!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on San Marco... pleasantly a short distance away from the throngs”
Reviews.Author: katermc
Reviews.Content: Located just to the north of Fondamenta Nuove. Please remember this because if this is your first trip to Venice it is not easy to find...but just follow signs to Fondamenta Nuove. Okay that aside, this place was a great value for staying actually in Venice. The hotel is nice, relatively modern and pretty clean (definitely had daily maid service). Couple things Americans are not used to: they will take your passport for a short time upon arrival (this is normal and you will get it back), you leave your room key when you go out, and there is a cord in the shower (DO NOT pull it; it is an alarm). So now the review...the place really is a great value in Venice. The room is nice but really nothing fancy. I thought the pictures online were pretty accurate. Breakfast was like adequate, nothing spectacular by any means but the coffee was good, made to order and free flowing.Our view out our windows was of the lagoon, the cemetery island and murano in the distance. We really liked that this was located in a sort of off the beaten path (but not overly so as we had a Venetian metro stop 20 meters from our door). Venice can be packed with thongs of tourists and that was something to be avoided for us. This place was perfect for that. We could wander the back alleys of Venice mainly by ourselves and then walk from the hotel for about 12 minutes down to St Marks at night to enjoy a bottle of wine. There is a great restaurant really close to hear with tables on the water. Get their pizza as it was the best we had in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A very good 3 star hotel for a fair price in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: FelipeRocha
Reviews.Content: this is a good 3 star hotel. Bedroom and bathroom well equipped; good housekeeping; good location for those who want to stay near the Piazza San Marco and the Rialto, but far from the crowd (though there is no Vaporetto to the hotel after 23:00 and you have to walk about 8 min from San Marco. The hotel manager tould us it was totally safe, but Venice is a little scaring at night, like a ghost city.). In the first two days we could not access the internet from the hotel, because of a router problem, which was later resolved. The breakfast is simple but sufficient (orange juice, coffee, milk, bread, toast, jam, butter and nutella).

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice”
Reviews.Author: tric1003
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in Room 4 which was clean and tidy and with wonderful views across to Murano, and of the Lagoon. Matteo is a wonderful host. He is welcoming, engaging, interested and knowledgeable. Most importantly being a native Venetian, he is passionate about Venice and ensuring that you see the true Venice and not just the Tourist Traps. The location of Hotel Vecellio is right on the waterfront at Canareggio outside the Fondamente Nuova ferry terminal which makes finding the Hotel on your arrival so easy. And you don't need to carry your luggage up and down stairs, over bridges and over cobblestones. Believe me, this is a true blessing when travelling in Europe! Once you become familiar with the streets it is less than a 10 minute walk to St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. However getting lost is part of the deal in Venice. If in doubt or if you get lost it is easy to hop on a ferry back to the Hotel! There are restaurants outside of the Hotel and a supermarket nearby. The other plus is that this part of Venice is less touristy so we were able to observe a slice of typical Venetian life. Otherwise whilst we found Venice to be incredibly beautiful and fascinating, it was overcrowded with tourists and felt like a theme park populated with nothing much than souvenir shops and pizza joints. A tragedy! The included breakfast is very simple and if not for Matteo's coffee I would give it a miss. The food is all prepackaged and even the bread rolls are rubbery. Go out and grab a brioche! Due to the location and Matteo's hospitality we will be returning to Hotel Vecellio when next we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMarsh
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vecellio is in a fantastic location, having spent time lost in Venice, we were greatful for the ease at which we could find the hotel- it's literaly on the doorstep of the water bus service, very easy! Matteo was very helpful whenever we needed advice and was a fab friendly face at the desk. The desk is also manned 24 hours a day which is useful when you have early/late flights. The room was very clean and spacious, looking out over the lagoon, perfect (although boats run through the night and can be a little noisy)! The bathroom is a little small but this didn't make any difference. Breakfast was at good times, although everything was prepackaged and could have had fresh bread or something, but the fresh Italian coffee made up for it. This hotel is in a great location for being out of the crazy hustle and bustle of the touristy centre, but still very easy to reach everything. The price and location were fab and we'd definitely recommend them to others.

Reviews.Title: “We return to Hotel Vecellio every year because we love it.”
Reviews.Author: NorOntario
Reviews.Content: We love the location, the price is right and Matteo is fun. The rooms are clean. It is close to many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in charming area of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lo_Newcastle_UK
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad we found this hotel..... Everything from the cheeky smile and friendly welcome of Matteo (the manager), the standard of the rooms was fantastic, small but very well kept and decorated. The location as others have said is perfect, it is right opposite the Fuerta Nove waterbus stop which means you can get the waterbus straight from the airport without changing in about 40mins. I stay in lots of hotels but have never been compelled to leave such a good review. One thing to add is that I recommend asking Matteo for his recommendations on restaurants, he will send you off to some fabulous places full of locals where you will find some exceptionally good and well priced food. Venice is said to contain more bad restaurants than good, so this is a great tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer_NW_London
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while in Venice. The hotel is perfectly located - next to the water bus stop from the airport, for around Venice and the islands. The hotel manager was very welcoming and helpful and the night time staff were very lovely too. The room was clean and perfect for our stay - while in Venice you'll only see your room to sleep. Great value and in a nice quiet location - 15 mins walk to St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkDebbie34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and the hotel was very clean, rooms adequate and the location was great. Its about 15 mins walk from rialto bridge and about 20mins to st marks square, thats if you dont get lost!!! (You generally do!) It was very easy to get from the airport by water bus, cost $25 euros p.p. return. My tip is to get a unlimited day pass for the water buses and you hop on and off as much as you like, saves your legs!! Matteo was a lovely hotel manager who had plenty of tips of where to eat out and places to visit. I would definetly return to this hotel again as reasonably priced. Enjoy Venice, its a magical place

Reviews.Title: “be careful all who book here”
Reviews.Author: rosegary
Reviews.Content: we had booked 6 months beforehand but on arrival the manager had double booked and we were transferred to a room above a restaurant some distance away for the first 2 nights. Manager said that he double booked the previous month and it seems this is a regular occurence. Upon returning to our original hotel on Saturday we were located in a converted house around the corner and not in the original hotel as we had thought. Although the rooms were nice this was not what we had booked. Altogether a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn115
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel - so easy to reach from the airport, just a few mins walk from the Grand Canal and far enough away from the crowds to make it feel homely. Rooms are small (as are all the rooms in Venice hotels) but spotlessly clean and comfortable. Matteo and Beata are great hosts and can not do enough for you - they know some great places to eat and will answer all your queries. Breakfast is fine - I don't like full english so the continental breakfast with fab italian coffee was fine for me. Would go back again and again and would recommend this little gem to everyone. Bellisimo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: johngordon37
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in ok location although it is a long water bus ride to the main tourist areas everywhere is wuthun walking distance and the bus stop is outside the hotel which can be a little noisey. The design & furnishing of the hotel is very nice and makes for a pleasant stay. The room was clean with exception to what seemed to be dust on the walls from recent building work, our room was serviced every day although one day we were not provided with toilet paper. The breakfast was very simple but sufficient given the price of the rooms, consisting of mainly breads but coffee was freshly made. Breakfast is not served until 8am which is a shame as it's a long wait from the night before when most of Venice shutsdown at 10pm. For this reason it would also have been nice to have had Tea & Coffee making facilities in our room. The staff were very friendly. I would recommend this hotel as a very pleasant plcae to stay & good value but basic.

Reviews.Title: “Venice's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsMangoKat
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice many times and the hotel Vecellio is one of my favourite places to stay. The location is simply superb - a bit removed from the tourist crowds (but only a short walk away from the hotspots), and with fantastic views over the laguna. The rooms are decorated in the typical Venetian style, with lots of baroque ornaments, making you feel like a princess, and the owner, Matteo, is very helpful, friendly and fun to talk to. Hotel Vecellio to me is nothing less than Venice's best kept secret.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, well located and with friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: rubaron
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for the first time for a weekend, and the hotel was a nice surprise. Conveniently located in front of a waterstation coming from the Marco Polo International Airport, the hotel is a charming building, recently restored and with all the comfort you could need to make your stay in Venice very special. The rooms are very clean , well equiped and with a nice view of the lagoon. The warm attention of Matteo, the manager will make your stay even nicer and for sure he will recommend the nicest places to eat and to go for drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean and close to water bus stop”
Reviews.Author: William_USA09
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two days. One of the reasons we chose this hotel is that we had a big suitcase so we wanted to find a place close to a water bus station. This hotel is really close to the water bus station "Fondamenta Nuove", which has water bus from and to the airport everyday. The room is clean and quiet. The price is affordable. Overall, it's a great experience in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: estevens
Reviews.Content: The Vecellio is in the perfect location...away from the San Marco tourist madness but only a 15 minute walk away. Located directly on the lagoon and within steps of transportation. Rooms are smallish but beautifully furnished. Matteo, the owner, is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “would go again”
Reviews.Author: soshiningsoblue
Reviews.Content: Manager of hotel is helpful and friendly. Modest hotel ideal for couple staying within tight budget. Very close to the waterbus "vaporetto" stop.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel that doesnt cost a fortune”
Reviews.Author: yummymum06
Reviews.Content: booked this for a romantic break as it didnt cost a fortune unlike a lot of hotels in venice i was worried about what it would be like i was not disappointed it was beautifully kept rooms where beautiful and lovely and warm which was great after being out in the rain most of the day . out the front door of the hotel was the water bus stop so easy to get to and from the airport ,hotel manager was very helpful recommended great restaurants to us would definitely go back to venice and to this lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: MagdaGR
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and had a great view! If I went to Venice again, I would choose the same place , since I enjoyed the stay and I loved the kind and friendly Mateo & his great cappuccino!

Reviews.Title: “Room was basic/fine, hard to communicate”
Reviews.Author: forevertravel31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel after reading some very good reviews on Trip Advisor. For some reason, we did not have fully the same experience. We knew when we reserved that the location is not really close to any of the main sites (it was less expensive to stay farther away) and it turned out fine as it's a fun walk (lots of getting lost in the beginning!) and an easy, convenient connection to the vaporettos (right outside the hotel's front door) if you want to enjoy traveling leisurely along the Grand Canal via boat to get to the sites, and to connect easily to the train station. The room itself was fine, simple. We were on the 1st floor in room #1. It was quite small (though that didn't really bother us), hard bed, and you could hear everyone going up and down the stairs next to your room. Bathroom was tiny (again, not unusual for Venice) with no extras like soap even (they gave you little shampoo packets that they seemed to think passed as soap, but. they were not useful). Breakfast was the lightest we had at any of our five hotels in Italy- basic coffee, juice, yogurt, bread (no fruit, meats, cheeses, hard bolied eggs, etc). As far as service... We seemed to always have one of two older gentlemen running the front desk when we were coming or going. While I'm sure they were nice people, one did not speak a word of English, the other very little, so it was extremely difficult / frustrating to try to communicate. We got zero information about Venice from this hotel (even after we asked)- no map, site listing, recommendations, etc. Needless to say, we were a little disappointed as usually a hotel/B&B is a great source of local information. Overall, I would say the hotel was adequate and gave us a place to sleep at night but really did not make us want to come back. Venice, on the other hand, is amazing and we definitely hope to return some day!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location - perfect hosts”
Reviews.Author: Naddywot
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vecellio is situated on the outer edge of Venice making it easy to find and hard to miss. There is a water taxi stop right outside the door and the boat to the airport stops there too. The walk to San Marco Square is only 15 minutes. The hotel is authentically decorated and the hosts are true Italians willing to help with any matter and make your stay enjoyable. Our room overlooked the water and was charming, clean and cosy. I highly reccommend Hotel Vecellio and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: andyfromcanada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a wonderful three nights in Hotel Vecellio as part of our honeymoon. We had a beautiful room overlooking the lagoon and Fondamente Nuova. All of the hotel staff was polite, funny and knowledgeable. They spoke very good English and had a helpful sheet with attractions, maps, and restaurants that they gave us at check-in. The location is awesome with easy access to the airport via the ferry, and also to the rest of Venice via the vaporetto water bus system. It is also only a 5-10 minute walk to Realto Bridge and 15-20 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. Be sure to sit in your window and have a glass of wine in the evening and watch the sunset. Very reasonably priced for Venice at 110 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, superb service!”
Reviews.Author: Gembo_notts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights & had a great time, Matteo is a great guy & recommended some lovely restaurants & gave us some great tips, he also makes a lovely espresso!! The hotel is loacted 2 mins from the Fondamente Nouve stop on the water buses & is also conveniently located near the Agliaguna Blue line stop that takes you to Marco Polo airport. It's about 15 mins from Rialto & St Marcs, you can also catch a water bus direct to Murano (a must when in Venice) & Lido if you fancy a day at the beach. It is a small hotel, about 8 rooms in total furnished in true venetian style with everything you need, including a fridge which was great for storing water in!! however our room (5) had a view of a side street which during our stay was having some works carried out on it which meant we were woken every morning at about half 6 by workmen digging & hammering!! The rooms are air conditioned but we still found them a little on the hot side, although we were visiting in the height of summer!! Breakfast is as you would expect, no more than a few bread rolls but the coffee is superb! We really enjoyed our stay at Vecellio & would happily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this gem when in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelingbyrd
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with good location to sites and waterbus station. The room was very good, small but this is normal for Europe (if you want a larger room you'll pay more) at a good price.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The day person was funny and very helpful. Has a great recommendation for a LOCAL Restaurants close by with great food. Don't miss this.

Reviews.Title: “wow! what can i say”
Reviews.Author: anne-and-bernie
Reviews.Content: My husband and i booked a 2 night stay to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary on 7th July 09. We emailed matteo to advise of our special occasion and asked for a room with a water view for a memorable stay if possible. We stayed in the green room with a superb water view just feet from the front window and 'quaint' crumbly buildings from the side window-perfect. Matteo showed us our room which did not dissapoint. Complete with a beautifully restored centurys old wooden beamed ceiling combined with a recent wood floor and elaborate 'venetian' drapes and furnishings all adding to the ambience. By some standards quite small but for venice standards not at all so. Yes the bathroom is very small but not a problem as modern luxury feel and never ending hot showers.Also a handy mini-bar which we cooled a bottle of 'champers'-on more than one occasion! Air conditioning is included in all rooms. On a final note for rooms the bed is huge and vereee comfortable and plush. Have to agree with all previous reports on excellent arrival location and easy walking for all major attractions etc. We walked for hours through winding alleys, stopping here and there for drinks or ice creams, not really knowing or caring where too as all roads seem to end in st. marco square eventually! Comfort not fashion is a must for feet.- heed this warning or suffer!! Some wonderful restaurants just behing hotel-please ask Matteo for advice as he knows his stuff and you wont get stung. Prices are not cheap but not OTT either if you take his reccomendations- we had 2course and wine etc for 60E saving at least half price if we had ventured further into Venice. What more can we say except a huge thankyou to Matteo and his beautifulllllll wife for making our special occasion just that! We will come back to this little gem of a hotel again another time and will reccomend to anyone for a venice break. So until then CHEERS!! From a very happy Anne and Bernie Watson from the north-east of England.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Tamkla
Reviews.Content: This small family owned hotel is in a great location right by the water, and close to the water bus station. The room was small, but very clean, quiet, nicely decorated and cleaned every day. The breakfast was simple, but everything was fresh all the time, and was included in the price. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!, Great location, great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azlan606
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 3 nights over a long weekend with my girlfriend, we both loved it, only 2 stops (40mins) on waterbus from the airport and hotel is just down from the taxi stop. Friendly welcome, clean rooms, small but I understand all venice hotels are like this, good views over the sea. Within walking distance of all the major sites. It gets quiet at night but some bars 10 mins walk towards grand canel. We were on a budget so had to be careful where to eat, Matteo the owner had some great recommendations who looked after us. Its easy to get ripped off as a tourist in venice. No room service or alcohol at this hotel, not a problem for us just a warning. Overall a great little hotel, great vaule would definitly stay again. Check the weather before you go if there`s any chance of rain pack some welleys!! Highlight: After being in Venice 24hrs my girlfriend only just realising there is no cars! LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Great reasonably priced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kabaddi
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! We stayed for two nights in March. It is right on the Fondamente Nove vaparetto station, and has great views across the sea. It's about a 15 minute walk to Rialto or San Marco and the surrounding area has lots of churches and sights although it's a little quieter at night, there are still some great places to eat if you want to explore a bit. Lots of yummy places to grab a coffee too. The room was lovely, really clean and spacious and a really good mini-bar! The staff are great, really friendly and will give you tips on where to go etc during your stay. We loved this place and I would 100% stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel on the Adriatic Sea.”
Reviews.Author: faithc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to this hotel on our honeymoon in November 2008. The location is not bad, but then again, nothing is really â€œfarâ€� in Venice. This hotel is on the Adriatic Sea, not on one of the canals. A very important thing to note. If you are going during rainy season, you will not be able to take a water taxi to or from this hotel. During heavy rain, you have to walk to the Grand Canal, which is about a 10-15 minute walk, and take transportation from there. Also, donâ€™t get on a water taxi the wrong way, it is very easy to do so. However, if you are coming in from the train station, you can take a water taxi almost to the front door of this hotel, which is convenient. The hotel doesnâ€™t have any great local restaurants. You will have to walk a bit to get to any decent ones. The hotel was clean, but very old. It is a very small hotel with only a few rooms. Breakfast was okay. Overall, a decent hotel, but I wouldnâ€™t stay there again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: soybot
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Italy and was a good one. The Hotel is newly renovated and the room was small but beautiful. Matteo is a great host and was quite happy to recommend resturaunts as well as help us select sites to visit. Breakfast was simple but good, (excellent coffee). We spent alot of time selecting hotels for this trip, mainly depending on TripAdvisor reviews. We were looking for a balance of reasonable price, convenient location, and high marks. This fit the bill and we were not disappointed. Thanks TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: IncognitoV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in September. We booked this hotel based on the good reviews from Trip Advisor. The location of the hotel is excellent, just off the vaporetto stop so very convenient with luggage. Just take the vaporetto from the train station. We had requested a lagoon view but unfortunatly none were available. So we were on the 2nd floor with view of a side alley. It was not bad but the room was quite dark so not a nice surrounding when you just wanted to relax after a long day of exploring but the location, cleanliness and the price is well worth it. The only problem was the electricity in the room. We had to close all the lights, TV, AC so my hairdryher could work. The breakfast was o.k. Venice is quite expensive so this little hotel is a good deal. Would definitly go back. And yes they do recommend nice restaurant oustide of the <tourist< area.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: BTMCPA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a pretty good location, next to the Fundamente Nove vaporetto stop and within 20 min walk of San Marcos and Rialto areas. The hotel is a little off the beaten path, and provides some getaways from the normally crowded streets. We enjoyed walking back and forth to/from the hotel to the more touristy spots, as it allowed us to see a different side of Venice. The rooms were nice, clean, and fairly decent in size. The room's electricity is only on when you're in the room, so it can get a little warm during the summer and takes a little bit to cool down, as the air conditioners are less efficient. The breakfasts are good and served downstairs in the lobby. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Hatt-away
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a couple of nights in Sept 08. It is in a great location and easy to get to from the Airport. Matteo is a lovely, enthusiastic host. We had a nice room over looking the lagoon, however as always in Italy the bathroom is small. Breakfast is bread, jam, yoghurt and wonderful coffee. Actually it's just enough to get you through to lunchtime. Take the advice from the hotel for places to eat, as Venice can be a rip-off, they are locals and know the best places, also they can give you advice on trips - just ask. The hotel is 10 minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge and has plenty of bars and places to eat close by. It is a nice comfortable walk into the heart of the city. I would recommend this hotel to others who want to be close to the sites, but away from the crowds of tourists. I also hope to stay there again in the near future. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “away from tourist crowds”
Reviews.Author: wupsydaisy
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location as the vaporello stop is right in front of the door and it's away from the terrible tourist crowds. You can perfectly enjoy the pease and quietness, as well as oserve the life of the locals. But the shower has no door which is a minus as water gets on the floor, the breakfast is not very good - some bread and not tasty croissants, yoghurt and orange juice. if you stay ther for a week at the end you don' t want the breakfast at all. still, the staff is friendly and the room cosy!

Reviews.Title: “Happy to recommend, happier to return”
Reviews.Author: GinSA
Reviews.Content: En route to a cruise, we were unfortunately only able to spend one night at this hotel - but would happily return and make it a base to explore Venice and the surrounds. Chose the hotel based on location - there were four of us women with luggage and those of us having been to Venice before knew of the challenges. The hotel was literally 100 metres from the water bus station and it is also an easy walk to the main quarters of Venice. Therefore do not discount it because it appears - on the map - to be away from the main hub. Quite the contrary.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: slippers56
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Vecellio and I have to agree with all the previous excellent reviews for this little gem of a place. Transport-wise, it couldn't be better; the vaporetto stops right outside the door. Our room was lovely, as was the breakfast. Matteo is a brilliant host, and enjoys every opportunity to practice his already excellent english. If you haven't yet been to Venice, you are missing the experience of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great host”
Reviews.Author: Neve705
Reviews.Content: Great directions from Vecellio as to how to get to there by waterbus meant that our trip from the train station was easy and fast. On arrival we were greeted warmly by Matteo and led to our comfortable ground-level room. The room was clean and well-appointed, and the bathroom, though a little tight, was also very clean. Best of all, the room had air-conditioning, which was lovely at night. We found Vecellio to be in a great location - right at a waterbus stop, near a residential area, and a quick walk to both San Marco and Rialto. Breakfast consisted of juices, coffee, breads, jams, and yogurt - plenty substantial enough to give a good start to a long day of walking in Venice. Vecellio is a good value and location in Venice and we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: fogtownrog
Reviews.Content: After finding this hotel on Trip Advisor and reading positive reviews, I quickly booked this property for my recent trip to Venice. Although the hotel's location is slightly remote from major tourist attractions, it is convenient to a major vaparetto stop between the airport and Venice and also just two stops away from Murano. It was only a 10 minute walk to Rialto and the center of Venice. What I liked was my room. It was large, for Europe standards, clean and fairly attractive. The bathroom was more than adequate, modern and clean. The WiFi worked very well. What I didn't like were the amenities and breakfast. In the bathroom the hotel provides a bar of soap similar to what trashy motels used to provide in the 50's and 60's... The breakfast wasn't up to par. The orange juice was terrible and the rolls were average. It was not the kind of breakfast one finds in most European hotels. I found it lacking. The manager makes a big deal about restaurant advise and how I should stay away from tourist restaurants. He sent me to a restaurant farilry close by and I was surrounded by fellow Americans! That in itself was ok...but the food there was just average and the portions were fairly small. Lastly, don't be fooled by the web site. It presents a much more elegant property than what it honestly is: adequate, clean and basic. Not bad, but not great, either.

Reviews.Title: “Vecellio lovely”
Reviews.Author: Luke1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value for money. We stayed here for part of our honeymoon, the hotels seems recently refurbished and very clean. The room was very pretty with a beautiful carved four poster bed. The rooms wern't massive but didn't seem small neither. Bathroom was very clean and new. The hotel is right on a water taxi stop which is convenient from the airport and not too expensive. The owner was a very nice bloke and managed to get us in one of the top restaraunts. He was very helpfull as all the staff were. The hotel is right in venice which is good and about 20-30 minute walk to st. marco square. As for venice is was very pretty and a deffinate once in a life time, but very, very expensive, you even have to pay to use the toilets. The people are ok but seem a bit wired.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !!”
Reviews.Author: RhonddaRebel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from spending 2 nights at this hotel. We booked it via the Easyjet website which was considerably cheaper than the price quoted direct from hotel. Arrival at the hotel could have not been easier - the water boat leaves from just a few minutes outside the airport (well signposted) and takes approx 30-45 mins to reach Venice (2nd stop). It cost 12 euro's each way - which is quite expensive, but is the easiest way to reach hotel from airport. As previously mentioned the stop needed for the hotel is literally just a few minutes away & really couldn't be much closer. We stayed in room 6 which had plenty of room though unfortunately did not look out directly onto the lagoon - it had a side view. Air conditioning could be adjusted as needed. Breakfast was adequate but would have benefited from some cereals & fresh fruit. Location of hotel was great. You'll need a good map to help you get around because there are numerous lanes and allyways to get lost in-but that's part of the fun ! We used tripadvisor when researching where to stay and agree with the previous reports on this hotel. The staff were very friendly and I would definately recommend this hotel to family & friends thinking of visiting Venice. Loved Venice & can't wait to return. We'd certainly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: MJCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Based on comparative prices in Venice this hotel is great value for money. It is a bit of a walk from the main hot spots but you're never far from the action in Venice. If you don't catch the water taxi to the hotel from the train station it will be about a 20 minute walk. Breakfast was included and was good without being anything special. The hotel staff were very friendly and happy to give recommendations for restaurants and things to do. The room we had was a double (2 single beds pushed together) with it's own bathroom - although the shower curtain did little to stop the water spraying the floor. WiFi was available for free if you had your own computer. The hotel was a little dated but still worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: chuckenpen
Reviews.Content: We took the water bus Alilaguna from the airport to the hotel it was the second stop at Fondamenta Nove, take a left over the bridge and the hotel is there on your right with a small canopy over the door. It was late when we arrived after a quick check in we were taken to our room upstairs no.6., which overlooked an alley way.The concierge/night porter showed us around the room as to where everything was. On first look around the room i was blown away by the old world features and charm of the place. With huge wooden beams in the ceiling, ornate headboard, lamps and mirrors. The bathroom although on the small side had everything one needed including a hairdryer. The room was stuffy and hot so we opened the window as the air conditioning unit seemed to be only for show and didn't work. Big mistake opening the window as we learned the next day. My husband and i were eaten alive with mosquito's. Also on closer inspection the room looked like it hadn't been dusted in a year with the amount of dust on the desk and shelves by the bed and there was black mould on the bottom of the shower tray. The walls were also in need of a coat of paint as it looked like we weren't the only ones who had problems with the mosquito's. As the hotel is right outside a water bus stop it can get noisy quite early on in the morning. The breakfast consisted of your basic continental breakfast of bread, croissants, yogurts, juice tea and coffee. The location of the hotel was about 15mins walk to San Marks Square once you find your way.

Reviews.Title: “very good....but could be better”
Reviews.Author: newland1
Reviews.Content: The previous comments are very fair . The hotels location is wonderful...grt area of the City . The views from our room ( no 8 ) just fantastic . The rate VFM for Venice . So why not 5 stars ? Water was not hot , breakfast very basic , and lots of noise at night from the rooms upstairs ( not part of the hotel , sounded like students playing football ! ) However really glad we stayed here , and i am sure the hotel is work in progress and will improve year on year . Some grt restuarants nearby , and in particular Ostaria Boccadoro in Campo Widmann .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ndcmuna
Reviews.Content: Great little place to stay! I did research on Trip Advisor (thank you fellow travellers!) before selecting this hotel. Quiet and away from the noise of heavily travelled tourist spots but near to Rialto Bridge and other sites. It's about a 15 minute walk to San Marco (if you know the short-cuts) and I would say 30-35 minute if you were a first timer and being adventurous. It is easy to get lost in the street of Venicia but all worth it-you'll find your way out somehow! There is also a Vaporetto stop RIGHT in front of the hotel-how convenient is that? Matteo was a wonderful host and we felt safe and snug in this hotel. Suggested a great place to have dinner which was inexpensive and wonderful! Rooms and bathrooms were clean clean clean! Breakfast was abundant with rolls, pastries, milk, coffee, juice; an assortment of yogurt and jellies. Loves: Strong water pressure, immaculate bathroom, friendly host Hates: We coudn't stay in Venicia longer

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: santiano
Reviews.Content: Just home from a three night stay at this beautiful little hotel. It is in a fantastic location - get the Alilaguna from the airport get off at the second stop Fondamente Nouve and over one bridge and you are at the door of the hotel! The hotel is very compact with about only eight rooms - We stayed in the gold room which was of OK size and adequate shower room. The original wooden beams on the ceiling and Venetian decor make it even more magical. Matteo the owner warned us that this was a warm room (for some reason) but as it was cold outside we didn't mind! Breakfast was fine - croissants, breads, yoghurts and a yummy choice of chocolate or cheese spread. I chose this hotel after reading TA reviews and because it worked out so cheap. It is fantastic value and would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, good value boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cielp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Vecellio and can wholeheartedly recommend it. We had read Trip Advisor reviews before booking and can confirm that most of them (mainly the complimentary ones) are accurate. Matteo, the owner/manager, is supremely helpful and speaks very good English. The bedrooms are small but tastefully furnished and comfortable with plenty of lighting. The hotel overlooks the busy Fundamenta Nove waterbus stop (accessible by direct boat from the airport, from the train station or the bus station) but the soundproofing is good so the noise is not a problem. In warmer weather one would presumably have to put up with the noise or use the aircon. An adequate continental breakfast is included in the very reasonable room rate. Travel is very easy. You can walk, if you don't get lost (which is always good fun in Venice!) to Rialto in about 7 minutes and to St Mark's in about 15. Frequent waterbuses from the front of the hotel take you to Murano, Burano and the other smaller islands or to the Lido or to Guidecca or right around Venice in either direction. It's well worth getting a timetable and a 1, 2 or 3 day travelpass from the office at the waterbus stop (31 euros for 72hrs) although not once in 3 days of extensive travel were we asked to show the passes! There is a great but somewhat expensive restaurant next door called the Alguibagio where the food is outstanding and the service superb and is ideal for a special celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: vivandtim
Reviews.Content: As the hotel only has 8 rooms, Matteo, the manager, is able to give a very personal service. As a born & bred Venetian, he knows all the non tourist sights & restaurants, & is happy to give suggestions.However he is not pushy either. Our room, the red room was lovely, with Venetian decor, and 2 windows, 1 overlooking the lagoon. Shower room is small, but newly installed & very clean. We enjoyed the tranquility of the location after the crowds in the city center. We would highly recommend this hotel to all out friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MattyBBath
Reviews.Content: Great location, 4 steps from airport taxi to lobby!! Warm and welcoming arrival and cosy (but large) room. The breakfast was excellent. Short walk through a non-touristy area to Rialto and San Marco. Stored bags all day before our flight. Eveyone at the hotel was amazingly friendly and helpful and recommended the excellent Trattoria Storica for dinner. Would HIGHLY recommend the Vecellio and will always stay here on future trips to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pollybuckland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in a very hot June and would thoroughly recommend it. The room was small (as every room in venice is), but full of character and really nicely done. We also had a great view out over the lagoon. Breakfasts were simple but tasty. The staff were really helpful. One of the major bonses about the hotel was its location. You were away from the main tourist areas, but with a vaporeto stop just outside it was easy to get to the main sites when you wanted. However, the joy of just wandering through the back streets was our preferred way to travel. The staff also recommended some great local restaurants - away from the tourist menus, and we had some fabulous and very reasonable meals. I'd certainly stay at this hotel again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nigelpm
Reviews.Content: A very nice recently refurbished hotel in the Carnaggio part of Venice right on the northern side of the lagoon but only ten/fifteen minutes walk away from the major attractions in Venice like Rialto Bridge/San Marco Matteo makes you feel incredible welcome and had a very good sense of humour - amusing me at breakfast. We only stayed two nights but the room was cleaned immaculately on the second day. Breakfast is fine - continental - choice of hot drink, juice/water - Jogurts - bread rolls - Croissant just be aware that it's a hike from the train station and/or bus station but to be quite honest it's an enjoyable walk as long as you have cases with wheels You can use the River boat straight from San Marco airport but it's a pricey 12 euros each way per person hence we got the more reasonably priced express coach at Euro 5.50 return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MissBunny
Reviews.Content: What can I say! Just come back last night from 4 nights at the Vecellio. Our room faced the Lagoon and though as per previous reviews the bathroom was small, it was not a problem, we do not spend our holidays in the bathroom! Breakfast was basic but that was not a problem. Lovely and clean. Lovely owners. Lovely decoration, could not ask for more. We walked everywhere apart from one day when we wanted to go to Burano and San Girgio. The water buses are a nightmare if you go in the wrong direction or didn't have a clue like us but it added to all the fun we were having. I would most certainly stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: stompin_pt
Reviews.Content: Pros: Matteo is very friendly, has great recommendations (including an excellent local pizzeria) and a charming personality. Liked the location, a manageable walk to major sights and convenient to vaparetto but a bit of distance from the crowds. Windows effectively blocked all sound. Cons: Our room (facing lagoon upstairs) was quite small and the bathroom was the smallest of all the hotels we stayed at in four weeks in Europe. Toilet did not function well. Bed was not a true double but joined twins (like most in Europe). Also, from previous reviews we expected that our lagoon view room would indeed have a view. But didn't realize that we were only one floor up and the view is really just of the vaparetto stop. Free breakfast each morning was a nice touch but lower quality than similar offerings from 3*'s. The housekeeper also barged into our room once while my wife was in, without knocking and without apologizing afterwards. Overall a neutral / average experience -- not horrible but worse than the other 2* and 3* hotels we stayed at in Florence, Verona, Positano, and Paris which were also at or near the top of trip advisor rankings.

Reviews.Title: “Matteo makes you feel welcome!”
Reviews.Author: teedle57
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a great introduction to the friendliness of everyone we encountered on our trip. Going to Venice was a dream come true and Matteo made us very comfortable, even changing our room for one with a view of the lagoon since we were on our honeymoon. The location was a bit off the beaten path as far as tourist sites are concerned, but that just meant we spent more time exploring the beauty of this wonderful place. Having a vaparetto stop right outside was convenient when we wanted to get somewhere directly, but most of the time we were happy to wander around and found we were really only 10-15 mins. walk from everything we wanted to see. Our room was clean and comfortable and breakfast was satisfying, plus Matteo made WONDERFUL coffee and gave us plenty of it. A delightful host and a lovely stay, what more could we ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Personality Plus”
Reviews.Author: missconceptionFrance
Reviews.Content: From phoning Matteo at reception to say when we were arriving, we were given good local information in regard to parking etc in Venice and excellentdirections on how to get there - after all it is Venice. We were met at reception by Matteo and his lovely partner Beata (excuse spellings), who quickly checked us in and walked us to the small guest house where our room was situated. Betea was enthusiastic and helpful, and an all round beautiful person. The room was lovely and the hotel personal and nice. only 6 rooms. We were given advice on where to eat in Rome, how to save money in restaurants and recommended restaurants. Beata is learning English, and she is doing really well. We could not have been made to feel more welcome, and really enjoyed the whole experience at Hotel Vecillio. Well done Beata for making it memorable, you are a fine hostess, and Mateo, thanks for everything. My partner and I will always recommend your establishment. Kind regards, Andrea x New Zealand and Jocke x Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice rooms and good price”
Reviews.Author: nordic_traveller2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the guest house section of the hotel (about a block away from the main hotel). Beata, who takes care of the guest house is one of the best hotel hostesses I have had the pleasure of meeting. She serves you breakfast and engages in conversation, giving you tips of what to do and eat in Venice, so that you feel right at home at once! She also makes sure that your room is in perfect condition. Staying at the guest house means that you do not have a view of the lagoon, which is possible in the main hotel, but the prices are very reasonable and as mentioned before the rooms are really nice and the service is excellent. . I can thoroughly recommend staying at Hotel Vecellio. /Jonas

Reviews.Title: “Matteo both entertaining and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: JanetWP
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Matteo and his hotel. He is both entertaining and accommodating. We had room # 6, while our friends had room #5. While both rooms and baths were small, they were very clean, and the double beds were comfortable. Each room has only a single window with limited light. Rooms 4, 7, & 8 have multiple windows with sea views and were much more desirable. The hotel is conveniently located (right at a waterbus stop) and yet away from the noisy crowds with plenty of good places to eat nearby. We would very definitely return to Hotel Vecellio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gardnerma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in October, 2007. Room was cozy, but nice. It was clean and had all the essentials. Convenient location right off the water bus line. Staff was very nice and willing to offer advice and suggestions on restaurants and such. No elevator, but there were only 2 levels, so it wasn't a huge problem. Breakfast was basic, but good. Did I mention that you basically step off the water bus and it is about 20 feet to the front door? Please remember that rooms in this part of the world are just small and not like they are in many other countries. Venice is a beautiful city and when you are only in your room long enough to sleep and clean up, how much room do you need? Hotel Vecellio does not have all the luxuries, but it is a clean place to call "home" during your visit to Venice. Although on a map, this hotel location may look like it is far from all the "action", Venice is suprisingly small and you can easily walk to the Rialto Bridge or St Mark's Square area.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived from Vecellio Hotel and I have mixed feelings. We paid 168 â‚¬ per room, per night taxes and breakfast included ,in a lagoon view room. The breakfast is nothing special, although the cofee is pretty good, but I think the hotel is quite expensive. Perhaps all the hotels in Venice are expensive but I feel that 168 â‚¬ is not the right price. The location is very good, in fact, if you do know Venice and you come from the airport with suitcases the location is perfect. Rialto and san Marco square are about 10 - 15 minutes walking trough nice streets but the room itself is really small. The bathroom is so small ( at least in my room, number 7 ) that you have to enter sideways. The wardrobe is enough for a weekend but no for a week and there is no enough place to leave the suitcases We had a very nice recomendation for an inexpensive dinner, Trattoria Casa Mia, five minutes walking from the hotel and we had a really nice dinner experience ( very expensive but worth the price, with small portions so do not go if you are hungry ) in the Fiaschetteria Toscana After all, I think that everything in Venice is overpriced and this hotel is not an exception, 100 â‚¬ per room per night should be more than enough, and it would not be cheap, but the question is, will you find anywhere better for 168 â‚¬? Enjoy Venice

Reviews.Title: “lovely views of lagoon”
Reviews.Author: venices11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this Hotel. The Vecellio has very nicely decorated rooms and is spotlessly clean. The staff were all very friendly. Matteo was very helpfull with restaurant reservations and always had a smile. We had a room overlooking the Lagoon and it was a lovely view in the morning watching the boats. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone that likes to get away from the hustle and bustle of ST Marks!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: baeteam
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and they were very on point. We booked because we read of the convenient location. Being next to the vaporetto stop was so nice especially since we came in at midnight and didn't have to haul our luggage far in the dark. Although you're not close to the traffic of St. Mark's, Venice is small enough where you can walk or take the water taxi all around and with the stop right in front of the hotel, it was extremely easy.
