Matteo is a great resource around the city. Breakfast is simply good and even when we woke up past the time, Matteo graciously served us. The rooms are tiny but clean. Worth every penny and then some!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TraveLibrarian18
Reviews.Content: I booked this room last minute through Venere.com when a tropical storm meant we had to leave Florida 1 day early last summer. Others are not exaggerating when they rave about Mateo. He truly was a helpful host, and he makes the perfect cup of cappuccino. We had the room right up front, closest to the "street" and the lobby, but we had no problems with noise. What makes the location so perfect is that the vaporetto stops just steps from the front door. I did not appreciate this until the next night when we had to drag our luggage through the paths and bridges to get to our other hotel. From here, trips to Burano and Murano (not to be missed) are very easy. It is a walk to get to the "tourist" areas such as the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco, but it gives you a chance to explore an uncrowded area of Venice - and to mingle with the locals. I highly recommend this clean, comfortable, and charming hotel. Don't let the location discourage you - it is a blessing in disguise!

Reviews.Title: “Lagoon view - Fab locale”
Reviews.Author: bagsrpacked07
Reviews.Content: Hotel Veceillo couldn't have been more convenient, coming in via water bus from the airport. The hotel is in a great locale for avoiding the August crowds and for taking in nice lovely sunsets over the lagoon. We loved walking around the neighborhood, very peaceful compared to other parts of Venice in August. Room we stayed in was nicely furnished and had a great view of the water. Construction outside was a drag, although surprisingly the walls to the street kept out the noise. Internal walls weren't as soundproof, alas. Staff are helpful if asked, although on our visit they seemed stressed by the August tourist season. We loved our four days in Venice and would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saraiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days,from 13 to 17 August.As everybody said rooms are big,comfortable and spotless.My room was at the basement overlooking the lagoon.Rooms are double glazed so we didn't hear any noise from outside.Nice decoration as well,and en suite toilet,T.V and fridge.Breakfast is continental style with a choice of yoghourts,juice,fresh bread and croissants,toast,butter,ham and coffee or tea (green or english breakfast).The hotel is located in Cannaregio area,it took us about 15 minutes walk to Rialto Bridge and another 5 minutes to Mark's Square.The location is very convenience as well for the Marco Polo airport (Alilaguna)and the local venice transport (ACTV),the stop is at the front of the hotel (Fondamenta Nuove).There are a lot of restaurants near by and there is a supermarket (Coop) about 7 minutes.Overall my stay was great,Matteo and other staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Mertta
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Vecellio and liked it very much. The hotel was easy to reach from airport and rooms are very nice and clean. Matteo and the others were friendly and helpful. The vaporetto-stop in front of the hotel makes trips easy and it is advisable to buy ticket for your whole stay. During three days we made about ten journeys around Venice and islands (+Alilaguna airport trips). We can really recommend this hotel for people, who likes to live a little far away from the noise and jam of centre but likes to move easily from one place to another. Many thanks to Matteo and other personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bibli0
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the vecellio in early June and although the weather was mixed we had a lovely time The location is great - direct water bus from the airport to the door and our room had views over the water. Rooms are spotless and decorated retaining the character of this old house.The area around the hotel is well worth exploring - its away from much of the crowds.Its easy to explore on foot from here- don't worry about a map its fun getting lost-but the water buses stop at the door. Matteo is great - we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myrtle_blue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Carnival. I think this a beautiful hotel. The room was excellent and spacious enough for the two of us. Breakfast was also very good. Matteo has a good sense of humor and helped us with any questions we had. The only downside was that the room was kind of hot. We were there in February and it was pretty cold outside so we couldn't really ask for AC or we might have froze. There really wasn't a happy medium. The location was good, right next to vaparetto. We were very impressed and we would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Mi Amore Hotel Vecellio”
Reviews.Author: SharonaN
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vecellio was the best Hotel I stayed at in Italy. It was safe, clean, the service was great, the room was so gorgeous I felt like I was staying in a mansion, and the best part was waking up in the morning and having the view of the canal. I can truly say Hotel Vecellio was the best Hotel I stayed at in Italy. I especially want to say Thank you to Mi Amores Mateo and Beata. Thank you so much for making my stay at your Hotel so pleasant. Sharona

Reviews.Title: “Matteo, Thanks for a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: bobmany
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in June 2007. The location is fantastic, straight off a water bus (42/52) and into the Vecellio. Matteo was an excellent host, friendly, great sense of humor and an AC Milan fan! We had a double and triple and both rooms were very nice as was the hotel in general. Great breakfast with plenty of Capuccino and "American Coffee". The first night we arrived, Matteo recommended a nice restaurant nearby and also provided easy walking directions to Rialto Bridge. I highly recommend Vecellio for those planning to stay in Venice. It was our kids favorite hotel on the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent value, great experience”
Reviews.Author: agtaisteal
Reviews.Content: This is a great little place, in an excellent location at the vaporetto stop & also 15mins from St Marks - a lovely interesting stroll through the less touristy areas of Venice. The rooms are very comfortable and well equiped. I'd have no problem recommending this hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Chris6h
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with only eight rooms. Matteo was a really great host and was able to give great recommendations. We also liked the location as it was right off of water boat stop and allowed you to walk through the canals to get to restaurants etc. A great hotel that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Vecellio”
Reviews.Author: Sea_Bass_21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vecellio in room 4 for 3 nights in May and were generally very pleased with our stay. Our room was beautiful and a decent size by Venice standards. We also had a lovely view of the sea. Also an ideal location as it is right off the vaporetto stop, only a 15 ride from train station. Mateo is an excellent host that tries make the Venice experience as authentic as possible. He also went out of his way to make sure we got the room with a view. Breakfast was good though the room was small but this was never an issue for us. The main sites are only 10-15 minutes walk and you are able to see more of the town and get away from the flocks of tour groups. There were a couple of bars nearby where we got glasses of wine but Venice in general in not much for nightlife. The only drawback to the hotel was the shower which had no door. As a result, the bathroom got really wet and messy though it could have been worse as the water pressure was fairly weak. The room also got hot at night as the AC was not turned on yet, the sea breeze cooled down the room but the noise from boats made it difficult to sleep. Mateo turned the AC on after our request and this made the room much more comfortable. Knowing this would not have changed my mind to stay at the Vecellio though. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay as the hotel was very charming and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “ideal position”
Reviews.Author: r.butterworth
Reviews.Content: We chose the Vecellio after reading reviews on TA. It is less than 100m from the first airport waterbus stop on Venice island. There is some construction work happening on the quayside but we heard nothing in the hotel. The hotel interior has recently been renovated to a high standard, bedroom was a good size and en-suite demonstrated what you could fit on postage stamp... small but very adequate for a short stay. Breakfast was simple, continental and sufficient to keep you going until midday, lots of restaurants nearby for an evening meal at all price levels. It takes about 10 mins to walk to the Rialto bridge and about 15 mins to St Marks Square but about 30/40 minutes by waterbus. Tip: for a super view of the Doge's palace cross the Grand Canal to San Giorgio and take the lift to the top of the bell tower. We had a great short break and will be reccommending the Vecellio to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: 2Sanders
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel, the excellent location for water bus connections to the city and the airport, the friendly staff and the fantastic restaurant next door. A really enjoyable experience. Very helpful manager. The photo on the website of the exterior was taken on a grey day and doesnt do it justice, I think.

Reviews.Title: “March 30th to April 1st”
Reviews.Author: chateaubell
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the host couldn't have been more helpful. He suggested two different restaurants which were fabulous. We arrived on March 30th leaving on April 1st - fortunately the rainy weather during our stay only hindered us slightly. We found the rooms to be comfortable {except for the excessive heat in the building - we asked to have it turned down and was told that it was as low as it could go}. Even though our hotel overlooked the water taxi stop, we could not hear anything from the out of doors - but we could hear everything from the couple next door who were having a major party and then a fight, which proceeded into the hall. I got up at 2am to ask the gentleman at the desk to ask them to quiet down. Either he did not understand me or was unable to do anything - but the host the next morning said that if it happened again to call the front desk and he will personally handle it. Fortunately, I was so exhausted that night that I did not hear the goings on that my husband had to endure through out the night - he did not want to cause any trouble, so he did not give the host a call. I am quite sure that the host would have immediately put a stop to the problem if only given a chance. We were not able to hear any of the other guests, so I am sure that this was a completely isolated insident.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Vecellio”
Reviews.Author: missmiddle
Reviews.Content: Can only agree with the other reviewers that this hotel is a great place to stay. We stayed here for 3 nights in September and really enjoyed the experience. Mateo was a perfect host, the rooms were clean as was the rest of the hotel and it is in a good location - off the main tourist trail, but central enough to walk almost everywhere and convenient for the vapporetto. The only very minor minus we could mention is that from the groundfloor bedroom we stayed in the noise of other guests on the stairs was quite audible. But this is a minor point, particularly as the hotel is so small. We would definetly go back and recommend the Vecellio to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation!!!”
Reviews.Author: supercecil
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews it has on this website and the reviews were right on! Our stay in Venice was enhanced by the excellent customer service that this hotel provided us. The owner and other hotel staff not only recommended great restaurants, but they went out of their way to answer any questions we had and to help out. The location of the hotel required a little bit of walking to get to the tourist sights, but this didn't bother us (and we had a toddler with us). The rooms were cleaned daily and they were spotless. The breakfast was better then the other hotels in Italy we stayed in, and the owner served us fresh coffee. There was also someone at the front desk 24/7, which we found very nice. I would not hestitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception, wonderful four-day stay”
Reviews.Author: Toulouse_Yankee
Reviews.Content: Everything positive said by other reviewers is absolutely true: charming, intimate 8-room hotel, front rooms with view of Lagoon and dockside activity, very convenient to transport by vaporetto everywhere including airport, Canareggio a fascinating quarter to get lost in from Lagoon to Grand Canal - less commercial than San Marco area although walking distance. The Vecellio is clean and cheerful. The bright spirit of the place is Matteo Secchi, without doubt the most genuinely hospitable hotelier in Venice. Maybe anywhere. Other staff also warm and helpful and speak some English. There is a dearth of good restaurants nearby but Matteo directs guests to the good ones, authentically Venetian and moderately priced. Tip: be sure to get 3-day vaporetto tickets; we got our money's worth in just half a day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: redhenry
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant small hotel, run enthusiastically by the personable and helpful Matteo. Clean, comfortable rooms, if a bit dark if you have one at the side, but Venice isn't famous for floor-to-ceiling plate glass. Right outside the door is the vaporetto stop at Fondamente Nuove and it's about ten minutes on foot to the busy and touristy bits of Venice. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a great find in venice”
Reviews.Author: ouzoi
Reviews.Content: reading the revues for the hotel vecellio on trip advisor we thought lets give it a go we were not let down its in a good position right next to the vapperto clean warm rooms a great host nothing was to much trouble for [matteo the owner ]told us were the good resturants are were all the locals eat so we never riped off the only downside we could find was a lot of dog mess in the streets so be carfull when walking we will always stay at the vecellio when in venice if its not booked [les and pam davis paxos and isle of wight ]

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: surfkay
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased we picked this hotel for our 2 night stay, after reading the reviews on here. The rooms are really well decorated and comfortable. We both slept like logs as there was very little noise in the area in the evening. We found the area very interesting to walk around and the main tourist areas were 10-15 minute easy walk. The vaporetto stop outside the hotel was very convenient if you dont want to walk any distance. Lastily the owner Matteo was very friendly and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rogoashear
Reviews.Content: OH MY GOSH!!!! This hotel is so beautiful!!! VERY Venetian, a recently restored traditional venetian house right next to the Fondamenta Nuove waterbus stop. The staff were very friendly (good suggestions on places to eat out in the area and possible excursions) and our room was absolutely stunning... Our only complaint would be that the bathroom was very cramped, but other than that it was amazing. I can safely say this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming wonderful service....”
Reviews.Author: mortadella
Reviews.Content: Just steps from the waterbus 42,51,52 or the Alilaguna from the airport, this hotel is cozy and classy at the same time. In a great neighborhood location for getting around to various parts of Venice too! Service is super! Stay here.....Matteo will treat you right! -LD

Reviews.Title: “Best of all worlds”
Reviews.Author: LMTravl
Reviews.Content: Matteo the owner could not be more accomodating or helpful. He made our visit to Venice memorable with great recommendations of 'local' restaurants. The location was perfect for us: away from the crowds, on the water, and at the Fondamente Nuove Watertaxi stop (easy to/from airport). The rooms were wonderful. Recently renovated, beautiful bathrooms with marble and tile, beamed ceilings, very clean, very comfortable. GREAT Value for the money, the best 'price-performance' in our 2 weeks in Italy. You can book directly at his website, [--]

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Venice 3 star we stayed in”
Reviews.Author: aurolingus
Reviews.Content: Matteo is one of several reasons this hotel is very nice - other reasons being, the price is reasonable, the location great, the other folks very personable /helpful, the breakfast quite adequate, the room quiet and clean. The hotel was very easy to find and only a short walk from the vaporetto stop, but take my advice - DONT OVERPACK. Pack your suitcases, then take out half. You'll never need it and if you do, they sell stuff in Venice! But make sure to haggle with the street vendors - don't pay their price right off the bat. More on how to do this in Trip Advisor Forums soon! The bathroom shower was a bit small but I am a bit large and there was plenty of hot water, not so the Ca'D'oro which was much more expensive and had no hot water the first night! We would try to stay in this hotel if we go back to Venice but if you try to book it, don't be surprised to find it full. It's a gem, so keep trying if your dates are flexible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Venice”
Reviews.Author: cpth
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) stayed 3 nights at the hotel. It occupies the ground and first floors of a recently refurbished mansion and was an excellent base: very comfortable, well-furnished and quiet rooms, and with good views over the lagoon from most rooms. It is just opposite the Fondamente Nove water taxi terminal which makes it an excellent base for getting around Venice and its environs and with easy access to the airport (the airport water taxi comes to the door). Matteo, the manager, speaks very good English. He is a fount of useful information about the area and gave us very good advice on where to eat etc. Lots of good restaurants within easy walking distance but without paying Piazza San Marco prices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: iciejan
Reviews.Content: Everything previous reviewers have said about this wonderful hotel is true. The rooms are beautifully decorated, the location - right by a boat stop - can't be beaten and Matteo is a little gem! Our room had a lovely view of the lagoon and it was great to look out of the window in the morning to watch all the comings and goings below. The bathroom was a little on the small side but was very clean and nicely decorated - and anyway, you don't spend much time in the bathroom! The room itself was immaculate and lavishly decorated. The air conditioning worked okay, and it was best to keep the windows closed to keep out the mosquitoes! I would suggest buying the 72 hour pass for the boats, as this really is the best way to get around - especially when so many boat stops (for many of the main lines) are right outside your doorstep. If you're planning a trip to Murano or Burano, the boat is just outside the hotel. The boat from the airport stopped a short walk from the hotel - over a bridge (bit of a pain with suitcases!). Overall we enjoyed our trip to Venice, but don't go in August unless you like to be there with loads of other tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Love Everything About It!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahATL
Reviews.Content: What an incredible find! This is the perfect little hotel. It seems much more than a 2-star. It is beautifully decorated in traditional Venitian style with Murano glass light fixtures, rich brocade drapery and bedspreads, immaculately clean marble floors, gorgeous water views. Amenities include phone, cable TV with CNN in English, hair dryer, efficient air conditioning, a shower with plenty of hot water. We loved the neighborhood where Hotel Vecellio is located. Besides being convenient to the Alilaguna boat from the airport and the vaporetta from the train station, other islands and points around Venice, we found the quiet, residential feel of the neighborhood to be so much more enchanting than the tourist mob scene around St. Marks, Rialto and the Academia areas. After doing the requisite sites in those areas we couldn't wait to get back to "our" neighborhood to watch the kids playing soccar with a little dog in Campo Gesuiti, to enjoy a drink and the afternoon sun at a cafe at Campo Santi Giovanni e Paolo, or just to wander around the picturesque narrow streets and imagine what it would be like to live in such a beautiful and unique city. I agree 100% with the other reviewers. Mateo is the perfect host. He is helpful, informative, and full of humor and fun. He arrives in the mornings with a bag of croissants and rolls still warm from the bakery and serves up a hearty breakfast with orange juice, yogurt, soft cheeses, wonderful little amaretto cookies, and the best cappuccino, all the while telling the guests in the tiny dining room, "Don't be shy, tell me if you want more". I highly recommed Hotel Vecellio as the perfect place to enjoy your time in Venice. We hope to go back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: johnivc
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location if you like a beautiful view over the lagoon, a perfect site for water transportation and a quiet area away from the hubbub of tourists. We walked 5 minutes from the airport to the Alilaguna water transportation (buy the ticket for 6 euros in the airport) and 30 minutes later you are at the island about 100 meters from the hotel. Matteo gave us excellent advice on local restaurants that had wonderful food and reasonable prices. The breakfasts included in the hotel price were more than we expected (croissants, rolls, biscottis, cheese, yogurt, juice, and the best Italian coffee). Matteo was friendly, helpful and has a good sense of humor. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel is at a Vaporetto stop and thus very convenient for going to the other islands or for taking the public water transportation. It is busy during the day but after 8 PM, it gets very quiet and we could sleep with the windows open. We would come back again and would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 4 days in a great spot!”
Reviews.Author: Dogenwurm
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 wonderful days in Matteo's great little hotel. Apart from the lovely decorated clean rooms and a very convenient location, it's the very personal touch with wich his owner leads his place, that makes it special. We definitely enjoyed our time there and we would recommended it without hesitation.
